website_summaries.verdict: The Aiaiai Tracks headphones deliver solid audio performance through a retro-meets-modern design.
pros: Surprisingly strong bass response, matched with clarity in the highs
cons: Very sculpted sound signature, at times too bright

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of AIAIAI Tracks. My previous pair lasted for nearly six years before they died. I continue to love them. I have moderate hearing loss which means I have to have the volume up loud to hear things through headphones and these cope beautifully. There is minimal sound overspill so I don't disturb my household too much. They're comfortable and lightweight so I can wear them for hours without getting sore ears. The microphone is an excellent added bonus when I'm using them with my mobile.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the purchase. Like how these sound and, especially, look like.
customer_reviews.author: Paulus

customer_reviews.title: But love them until they do
customer_reviews.text: They break after a while. But love them until they do.
customer_reviews.author: James Harford

customer_reviews.title: The earpieces fall off.  It's too hard to reattach them
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very good sound quality for music, and they also have a built in microphone without a boom for phone calls. Light weight. Compact. Fairly comfortable. Cons: The earpieces keep falling off the headband and are exceedingly difficult or impossible to reattach. They're poorly attached with tiny plastic beads. Jostling them frequently knocks them off. It's too hard to reattach them. I've given up on these and am discarding them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Knoll

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last for a year
customer_reviews.text: Alright the sound is not bad but, I've seen much much cheaper headphones with a lot more robust design and durable cables. The L shaped tip really doesn't work guys... Every time you put the phone in and out of your pocket it bends more, and the cable itself is thin. So not worth buying at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sergo N.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and durability, except the cable near the 1/8" jack.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, amazing sound, very durable too. 40 mm drivers pump out deep bass. My first pair broke after 3 months from the cord near the 1/8" jack being bent. It was replaced for free under the warrenty. This part could be better designed. I now wrap that part in a thin layer of electrical tape to decrease wear and tear on the cable. I think this help, and I recommend everyone do the same. That being said, I would recommend this product to everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice look, decent sound
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice looking headphone and it pumps out a lot of bass so that it's easier to hear your own music and block out other noise on the metro. Pros: Easy to "assemble" Very lightweight Small profile Cons: The earpieces will fall off if you put this in your backpack (but you can just snap it back in place usually) Frame is aluminum but the connection joint is a plastic ball-socket, so could wear out a lot over time "Soundstage" is all messed up from the bass boost
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: they still sound amazing and have structurally held up very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones three years ago, and though cosmetically they have aged, they still sound amazing and have structurally held up very well. For the price-point, size and weight, I don't know of many other headphones that compare in range or clarity, and the retro styling is fantastic. I have read reviews saying the clips that hold the speakers to the headband eventually wear down, but I have not had to replace anything on them yet. I love these headphones and will be buying another pair of AIAIAIs when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: WarrenGee

customer_reviews.title: Great set of Headphones for under $100
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. Clear and powerful. Not too bass-y but still can handle the low end pretty well. Headband fits well but is a little tight. I wear glasses so it puts a little extra pressure on my ears which I don't like but I know I can improve on that in time. My only gripe is when the cord is packaged, it is curled up and taped, therefore I have a straight cord that is curly like a pig tail. I'm gonna hang upside down to see if I can get that out. Other than those two slight issues, I am super happy with the sound and quality of these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Geez

customer_reviews.title: Retro Leaning, Forward Thinking
customer_reviews.text: Throwback-inspired design that doesn't sacrifice sound output or comfort for style. They are very well made, and I can wear them for hours at a time without any discomfort to my ears. They are easily adjustable, lightweight, and a marvel in simple but beautiful design. Go Denmark!
customer_reviews.author: Ovidio Calvo

customer_reviews.title: not terrible. hard to slide the headphones through the band ...
customer_reviews.text: not terrible. hard to slide the headphones through the band at times... and not as secure as i would have expected. but its clean and simple
customer_reviews.author: jessica lee

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality headphones - buy beware!
customer_reviews.text: One ear stopped working after a couple of months. Extremely flimsy. Considering the price, I expected much better quality. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Melina

customer_reviews.title: Blown within a month
customer_reviews.text: These were just okay - the metal headband is stiff and rather uncomfortable. The sound started out balanced, but the left speaker blew within a month of daily use. Switched to the "Sony DR-EX61iP" headphones for working out, and I like them a lot better. (Much cheaper too.) I'm not a general fan of in-ear buds, but these Sony's have a fourth size (extra small) earbud cover, which makes the fit very comfortable. Also the buds are offset to fit the ear canal more naturally. Save your money on the Aiaiais.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control?
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, but very suspect build quality. Returned mine because the foam earpad was falling apart and kept falling off after ONE DAY OF USE.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Groff

customer_reviews.title: These Things Desperately Need An Ear Clip Accessory!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the headphones, HATE the headband. Very cumbersome. (READ: unpocketable, for one thing.) I've lived with folding headphones for mobile use for a long time, but I'm just now noticing that some people make EAR CLIP models, with no band. I think that's the way I'm going to try next, but the sad part is that these modular things are all set up to *BE* ear clip headphones, they just don't provide an EAR CLIP ATTACHMENT, and they don't seem to offer one for sale either. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: River Flow

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with these headphones. They're lightweight, sound great and are very sturdy (I am generally rather abusive with headphones).
customer_reviews.author: Matty U!

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from the Google store inestead of Amazon but regardless it broke one month after buying it. When it works it works great but it has issues connecting to the usb c on my pixel it's useless 90% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Annelise Lupica

customer_reviews.title: Bad sound, bad usability design
customer_reviews.text: Adding a star for looking cool, but these are some of the worst sounding headphones I have ever paid for. The treble is terribly tinny, and the bass just does not really come through. I get comparable sound from the standard apple earbuds. Using the Tracks on the go? Throwing them in a bag usually pops off one (or both) of the earbuds, leaving a mess of wires to untangle when you want to listen again. I've had them for 6 months and the connections are already coming loose. These are just not made for urban wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Warman

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wear earbuds when I run, so that was my life. I saw the aiaiai and really like the simple style, and at the time they were on sale, so I went for it. Huge pay off! These headphones are awesome! Really good sound, fit comfortably, and the simple design and muted colors look really cool in the real, and the bass is surprisingly bassy. I was like damn, that's bassy.
customer_reviews.author: mindgrapes

customer_reviews.title: The sound that comes out of the earpieces is fantastic for the price point
customer_reviews.text: The sound that comes out of the earpieces is fantastic for the price point. The cabling they use is weak and will break if they are accidentally pulled on with not much force. Handle with care...
customer_reviews.author: Exo47

customer_reviews.title: Finicky volume controls
customer_reviews.text: These cans look and sound good. I even thought I had found the perfect pair. That is until I plugged them into my iPhone and started listening to music. At the sightliest touch the volume would turn up. I swear breathing on it was enough to turn up the volume. Two minutes into a walk, when the volume had turned to full blast for the fourth time, I deposited them in the nearest trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Hardcastle

customer_reviews.title: Sound good. Constantly detaching ear clips are annoying.
customer_reviews.text: They look very 1970s rollerskating 'wired for sound' with a retro styling from the first Sony Walkmans. The sound is good though has limited sound insulation. I find the clips that attach the ear pieces to the headset really annoying. They detach really easily in your bag, being knocked or light pressure, and are fiddly to reattach and very easy to lose. I'm not sure it is strictly a design flaw, as it probably protects the headset attachment from breaking -- it doesn't stop it from being annoying very time you have to reattachment them as they need specific alignment and pressure.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. JAFFA

customer_reviews.title: They get 2 stars because the design looks sweet and the sound is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased (rather foolishly) 2 pairs of AIAIAI tracks, and I received 1 replacement pair through their warrantee program. All three pairs have broken. It's always the same issue: the cable wears with natural movements at the device connection and inevitably one speaker stops working, followed soon by the other. To my view, this is clearly a design flaw. It doesn't matter to me anymore that they're inexpensive. Also, you really need to crank the volume on public transit, then the sound bleeds moderately. There's no noise cancellation whatsoever. They get 2 stars because the design looks sweet and the sound is as advertised. I should maybe give them 3 stars but I won't because now I'm bitter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: AIAIAI Tracks Headphone with Microphone - Black - 05401
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Tracks Headphone is an award-winning, supra-aural headphone with a subtle design, focusing on simple lines and an iconic shape.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



AIAIAI TRACKS HEADPHONE WITH MIC, BLACK
THE TRACKS HEADPHONE IS AN AWARD-WINNING, SUPRA-AURAL HEADPHONE WITH A SUBTLE DESIGN, FOCUSING ON SIMPLE LINES AND AN ICONIC SHAPE.
 * In the box:
 * 3 sets of coloured sliders
 * Carrying pouch

FEATURES
Flexible, light-weight, stainless steel headband provides good fit

Detachable ear cups for worry-free transport

3 interchangeable coloured sliders

Angled 3.5mm gold plated stereo plug

3 Button in-line microphone with all/music/volume control

Integrated tangle-free Y Connector

Soft, lightweight 2mm cables SPECIFICATIONS
Driver Unit Size 40 mm
Plug Angled Stereo Plug 3.5 mm
Speaker Impedance 32 Ohm
Speaker Sensitivity 112 +/- 3dB
Maximum Power Input 70 mW
Frequency Response 20-20KHz
Microphone Sensitivity -42 +/- 3dB
Microphone Directivity Omni-directional SIMILAR PRODUCTS TO CONSIDER
